title: Front Wheel - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Lightly smear the wheel spacers with grease and locate in the hubs.
Position the wheel between the forks ensuring the spacers remain in position on both sides.
Refit the wheel spindle from the right hand side and tighten to

Lower the motorcycle to the ground and position the front wheel up against a fixed surface. Bounce the front suspension numerous times to allow the right hand fork to float to its natural position on the wheel spindle.
Tighten the fork pinch bolts to
Thoroughly clean and degrease the brake discs.
